description: This contemporary public affairs course examines normative commitments and empirical evidence relevant to the workings of government, markets, and society as applied to contemporary issues. Possible topics include immigration, abortion, education, sexuality, medical care, foreign policy, income inequality and poverty, affirmative action, and responses to climate change. Not open to first-year students. Offered annually in the spring semester. Counts toward public health studies concentration. Prerequisite: PACON 280.
name: Contemporary Controversies
notes: Open only to Public Affairs Conversation students.
title: Public Affairs II: Contemporary Controversies
